sentence.Network_en: We use standardized tests to measure scholastic achievement.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们用标准化考试来衡量学生的学业成绩.

sentence.Network_en: There was a careful avoidance of the sensitive topic in the scholastic circles.
sentence.Network_cn: 学术界小心地避开那个敏感的话题.

sentence.Network_en: Your mother joins with me in congratulating you on your wonderful scholastic attainments.
sentence.Network_cn: 你母亲和我一道祝贺你学业上的巨大成就.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in sense 2 of the adjective): via Latin from Greek skholastikos 'studious', from skholazein 'be at leisure to study', from skholē (see school)

entry.def: Your scholastic achievement or ability is your academic achievement or ability while you are at school.

example.ex: ...the values which encouraged her scholastic achievement.
example.tran: 促使她取得学术成就的价值观

means.word_mean: 1. a person who pays more attention to formal rules and book learning than they merit
2. of or relating to the philosophical doctrine of scholasticism;

sentences.en: A scholastic work is to have a useful bibliography at the end of each chapter or the whole book.
sentences.cn: 学术著作应该在每一章或全书之后附有一份参考书目。
